author: Rob Polansky
title: ‚ÄòNot all patients are humans‚Äô: 14 puppies rescued from rollover vehicle crash
text: WOODSTOCK, CT ( WFSB /Gray News) - Fourteen puppies were rescued from a rollover crash that closed a road in Woodstock, Connecticut Thursday morning. Several fire agencies responded to Senexet Road between Laurel and Bull Hill roads for a single-vehicle rollover accident involving wires down. Firefighters found a pole that had snapped, with wires down, and called Eversource CT to disable the power. Power was out in the area while the electricians worked. Officials say minor injuries were originally reported, but no one ended up being hurt. First responders also rescued and provided care for 14 puppies at the scene. the Muddy Brook Fire Department shared photos on Facebook of firefighters interacting with the puppies. The Necogg Humane Society and a doctor from Peake Brook Veterinary Center responded to the scene to provide veterinary care and shelter to the animals, firefighters said. Some puppies will be taken to a veterinary office for further care. Drivers were warned to expect a ‚Äúlong duration road closure.‚Äù Copyright 2024 WFSB via Gray Media Group, Inc. All rights reserved.

author: ZULEIMA BALAGUERA
title: Los peligrosos criminales que est√°n con Brayan Campo en La Tramac√∫a
text: La C√°rcel y Penitenciaria con Alta y Media Seguridad de Valledupar, conocida popularmente como La Tramac√∫a, encierra historias macabras y hasta dif√≠ciles de contar. En sus instalaciones han estado los peores criminales del pa√≠s, esos que han sido noticia nacional por semanas y hasta a√±os, y que han despertado el repudio colectivo, dejando una estela de dolor que perdura. Sus instalaciones tienen una capacidad para 1.600 internos, siempre custodiados por personal del Inpec. Las instalaciones cubren 15 hect√°reas y est√°n a unos 3 kil√≥metros del per√≠metro urbano de Valledupar. La prisi√≥n, inaugurada hace 24 a√±os, est√° rodeada de maleza, un potente sistema de c√°maras de seguridad y se encuentra muy cerca del Batall√≥n del Ej√©rcito La Popa. No es nada sencillo llevar a cabo un plan de fuga. [Lea: Brayan Campo, confeso asesino de Sof√≠a Delgado, ya est√° en La Tramac√∫a](https://www.eluniversal.com.co/sucesos/2024/10/24/brayan-campo-confeso-asesino-de-sofia-delgado-ya-esta-en-la-tramacua/) Ahora, el centro penitenciario tiene un nuevo hu√©sped, se trata de Brayan Campo Pillimu√©, de 32 a√±os, confeso secuestrador y asesino de Sofia Delgado Z√∫√±iga, de 12 a√±os, ocurrido en Candelaria (Valle del Cauca). El hombre la rapt√≥ el 29 de septiembre pasado y las autoridades lo capturaron el 17 de octubre, luego confes√≥ su crimen y se√±al√≥ la plantaci√≥n de ca√±a donde dej√≥ su cuerpo en bolsas y desmembrado. Brayan es repudiado y su vida puede correr peligro debido a personas que desean tomar venganza por su cuenta, as√≠ como pas√≥ con varios de los que ahora son sus vecinos de celda. Estos son algunos de los peligrosos reclusos de esta prisi√≥n. Repudio, justicia y dolor 1. Javier Velasco asesin√≥, tortur√≥, empal√≥ y abus√≥ sexualmente de su amiga Rosa Elvira Cely, en un parque de Bogot√°, hace 12 a√±os. Cumple una pena de 49 a√±os de c√°rcel. Debido a este terrible crimen se fortalecieron las leyes para proteger a la mujer y establecer normativas con relaci√≥n al feminicidio en Colombia. 2. Rafael Uribe Noguera, condenado a 58 a√±os de c√°rcel por la violaci√≥n y asesinato de Yuliana Sambon√≠, una ni√±a de 7 a√±os, en Bogot√°. El hombre lleg√≥ en un veh√≠culo al barrio de la menor, el 4 de diciembre de 2016, la rapt√≥ y luego la ingres√≥ a una apartamento de su propiedad y seguido la asesin√≥ y escondi√≥ en un ba√±o. 3. Luis Gregorio Ram√≠rez Maestre, asesino serial conocido como ‚Äòel Monstruo de la soga‚Äô, quien mat√≥ a cerca de 60 mototaxistas en Cesar, Santander, La Guajira, Norte de Santander y Magdalena. Ocurri√≥ en un lapso no determinado y todav√≠a no es claro el n√∫mero de v√≠ctimas. Paga 43 a√±os de c√°rcel. 4. Wainer Ayola, se√±alado de desaparecer a Alexandrith Sarmiento Arroyo, de 15 a√±os, en una playa de Punta Canoa, corregimiento de Cartagena. Fue condenado a 42 a√±os de c√°rcel. 5. Peligrosos jefes de bandas criminales como Sebasti√°n Murillo Echeverri, alias ‚ÄòLindolfo‚Äô, cabecilla de la llamada Oficina de Envigado; Luis √Ångel √ösuga Murillo ‚ÄòMochi‚Äô, primo de ‚ÄòOtoniel‚Äô, extraditado a Estados Unidos por narcotr√°fico y l√≠der del Clan del Golfo. 6. Jhonier Leal, condenado a 55 a√±os de prisi√≥n por el asesinato de su hermano y su madre, Mauricio Leal y Marleny Hern√°ndez. Los habr√≠a intoxicado y luego acuchillado en su vivienda, adem√°s de torturar a su hermano realiz√°ndole un video y una carta de despedida. Otros peligrosos criminales que han estado en la c√°rcel 1. Luis Alfredo Garavito, el mayor asesino serial de ni√±os en la historia del mundo, con m√°s de 200 v√≠ctimas. Muri√≥ en octubre del 2023 a causa de un c√°ncer ocular y mientras pagaba 40 a√±os de c√°rcel. Estaba en prisi√≥n desde el 2001. 2. Manuel Octavio Berm√∫dez Estrada, conocido como ‚Äòel Monstruo de los Ca√±aduzales‚Äô y tambi√©n como el imitador de Garavito, fue acusado del asesinato y abuso sexual de por lo menos 34 menores en el Valle del Cauca. En el 2004 lo condenaron a 40 a√±os de c√°rcel, pero muri√≥ la semana pasada en medio de un ataque con fusiles a un carro del Inpec. Iba hacia Cali. [Lea: Asesino serial de ni√±os muri√≥ en ataque a camioneta del Inpec](https://www.eluniversal.com.co/sucesos/2024/10/18/asesino-serial-de-ninos-murio-en-ataque-a-camioneta-del-inpec/) 3. Orlando Pelayo, quien cumpl√≠a una condena por el secuestro y asesinato de su hijo de 11 meses, Luis Santiago, en 2008, muri√≥ en abril del 2023. Al hombre lo se√±alaban de asesinar a una expareja y a otro de sus hijos, pero nunca quiso hablar sobre ese caso y estas personas permanecen desaparecidas. 4. Jhon Jairo Vel√°squez V√°squez, conocido con el alias de ‚ÄòPopeye‚Äô, considerado uno de los sicarios m√°s peligrosos de Pablo Escobar, con m√°s de 300 homicidios encima. Muri√≥ de c√°ncer en la prisi√≥n.

author: @rmnb
title: Aliaksei Protas sets NHL record for most points by a Belarus-born player in a single season | RMNB
text:
Aliaksei Protas‚Äôs career year has been a lot of things: surprising, encouraging, and, at times, jaw-dropping. Now, it‚Äôs record-breaking.
Tuesday, after notching two assists against the Detroit Red Wings, Protas (61) eclipsed Yegor Sharangovich (59) for the most points by a Belarus-born player in a single season. Sharangovich set the record last season as a member of the Calgary Flames when he scored 31 goals and collected 28 assists in 82 games.
The news was first reported by Capitals PR.
With two assists against Detroit, Aliaksei Protas brought his season point total to 61 (29g, 32a). Protas' 61 points are the most by a Belarus-born player in a single season in NHL history (previously Yegor Sharangovich, 59 points in 2023-24).
‚Äî Capitals PR (@CapitalsPR) March 19, 2025
Protas‚Äôs big year comes during his age-23 season and marks a 32-point improvement over his performance in 2023-24.
Most points in a single season (Belarus-born) Player Pts GP Season Aliaksei Protas 61 68 2024-25 Yegor Sharangovich 59 82 2023-24 Mikhail Grabovski 58 81 2010-11 Andrei Kostitsyn 53 78 2007-08 Vladimir Tsyplakov 52 73 1997-98 Mikhail Grabovski 51 74 2011-12 Sergei Kostitsyn 50 77 2010-11 Mikhail Grabovski 48 78 2008-09 Yegor Sharangovich 46 76 2021-22 Andrei Kostitsyn 45 81 2010-11 S/T to Quant Hockey for the list.
The only other former Capital to join Protas on the list is Mikhail Grabovski , who, in his age-29 season with the Caps, notched 35 points (13g, 22a) in 58 games during the 2013-14 campaign ‚Äî good for 15th best ever.
After spending much of last season in the bottom six, Protas has 29 goals, 32 assists, and 61 points while skating primarily on the first and second lines this season. Protas recently notched his first career hat trick against the Anaheim Ducks on March 12 .
"He's one of our most valuable players every night."
Aliaksei Protas is having himself an incredible season! ü§© pic.twitter.com/iBnwOGL9zb
‚Äî NHL (@NHL) March 19, 2025
Statistically speaking, the six-foot-six, 247-pound forward has been one of the best players in the NHL. Incredibly, 56 of Protas‚Äôs 61 points have come at even strength (7th best in the NHL). His 46 five-on-five points are sixth-most in the league and pace all Capitals skaters (PLD has 44).
Protas leads the NHL in plus-minus at plus-42. The next closer player is Tampa Bay Lightning defenseman Ryan McDonagh, who is a plus-32.
Big Pro also has 17 multi-point games after posting eight the year before. There are still 14 games remaining in the season.
‚ÄúHe‚Äôs doing such a good job at five-on-five and on the penalty kill and in so many different areas inside‚Ä¶how well he‚Äôs putting pressure on the opposing defenseman, creating turnovers, good with his stick,‚Äù Capitals head coach Spencer Carbery said of Protas earlier in the year . ‚ÄúAnd then when he‚Äôs getting into scoring areas, you can just tell he‚Äôs got a ton of confidence. His shot‚Äôs improved. He‚Äôs hitting his spot‚Ä¶ Happy for him because he‚Äôs worked so hard and he‚Äôs such a great person and he‚Äôs so down to earth, so it‚Äôs nice to see him having so much individual success.‚Äù

author: Notretemps.com
title: Pakistan: manifestations contre un jugement favorable √† une minorit√© religieuse
text:
Pakistan: manifestations contre un jugement favorable √† une minorit√© religieuse
Des manifestations ont eu lieu vendredi au Pakistan √† l'appel de partis religieux pour d√©noncer un jugement du pr√©sident de la Cour supr√™me ayant trait √† l'incendiaire question du blasph√®me, qui lui a valu des menaces de mort √† peine voil√©es en ligne.
Le pr√©sident de la Cour supr√™me, Qazi Faez Isa, a √©t√© d√©nigr√© par la mouvance islamiste pour avoir ordonn√© la lib√©ration d'un homme appartenant √† la minorit√© religieuse ahmadie.
Cet homme avait √©t√© accus√© d'avoir diffus√© un texte religieux ahmadi interdit, un acte jug√© blasph√©matoire par les religieux conservateurs dans ce pays o√π m√™me des all√©gations non prouv√©es d'offense √† l'islam peuvent entra√Æner assassinats et lynchages.
Plusieurs rassemblements, r√©unissant environ 3.000 personnes, se sont tenus √† Peshawar (nord-ouest), apr√®s la pri√®re du vendredi.
"Mahomet est le dernier proph√®te" ou "mort aux Qadianis (terme p√©joratif d√©signant les Ahmadis)", ont notamment clam√© les manifestants, qui ont momentan√©ment bloqu√© des routes.
La Cour supr√™me du Pakistan avait vol√© jeudi au secours de son pr√©sident, en niant qu'il ait port√© atteinte √† la constitution avec ce jugement. "Cette impression est absolument fausse", a-t-elle affirm√©.
Un amendement constitutionnel datant de 1974 d√©finit les Ahmadis comme des non-musulmans. Il a √©t√© compl√©t√© par une loi en 1984 leur interdisant de s'affirmer musulmans et de propager leur foi.
Les Ahmadis sont discrimin√©s et pers√©cut√©s depuis des d√©cennies au Pakistan, o√π ils sont per√ßus comme h√©r√©tiques en raison de leur croyance en un proph√®te post√©rieur √† Mahomet, n√© au 19e si√®cle.
Un porte-parole de cette communaut√©, Amir Mahmood, a regrett√© la "propagande n√©gative et partiale" √† l'encontre de ce jugement, qui a √©vit√© √† un homme "d'√™tre pers√©cut√© pour sa croyance religieuse".
- "Ennemi de l'islam" -
Dans un jugement s'appuyant ostensiblement sur le Coran, Qazi Faez Isa avait ordonn√© la remise en libert√© de l'accus√©, au motif que la constitution garantit √† chacun le "droit de professer, pratiquer et propager sa religion" et que la "libert√© de religion est l'un des principes fondamentaux de l'islam".
Le jugement, dat√© du 6 f√©vrier, est d'abord pass√© inaper√ßu. Jusqu'√† ce qu'apparaissent sur X des messages reprochant au juge d'avoir "pris la d√©fense des ennemis du proph√®te", ou le pr√©venant que "quiconque touche √† la finalit√© du proph√®te invite la mort".
Les premiers messages sont apparus sur des comptes associ√©s au Tehreek-e-Labbaik Pakistan (TLP), un parti islamiste √† l'origine de violentes manifestations anti-blasph√®me et redout√© par les Ahmadis.
Les partis islamistes d√©fendent farouchement la loi qui pr√©voit la peine capitale pour quiconque est reconnu coupable d'avoir insult√© l'islam ou le proph√®te Mahomet, m√™me si aucun condamn√© n'a encore √©t√© ex√©cut√©.
La campagne contre le juge a rapidement gagn√© en vigueur, les islamistes voyant dans son jugement une tentative d'autoriser les Ahmadis √† propager leur foi et de red√©finir qui est constitutionnellement consid√©r√© comme musulman dans le pays.
Fazlur Rehman, l'influent chef du parti religieux conservateur Jamiat Ulema-e-Islam (JUI-F), qui a par le pass√© r√©clam√© l'application de la charia (loi islamique) au Pakistan, a d√©nonc√© une interpr√©tation du Coran "fausse et fond√©e sur de mauvaises intentions" de la part du juge.
Les talibans pakistanais du Tehreek-e-Taliban Pakistan (TTP), en lutte arm√©e contre Islamabad, ont √©galement qualifi√© jeudi Qazi Faez Isa d'"ennemi de l'islam", jurant d'infliger une le√ßon √† "de tels tra√Ætres envers la foi et la nation".
Pour nombre de Pakistanais, ces menaces font √©cho au meurtre en 2011, par son garde du corps, du gouverneur du Pendjab, Salman Taseer, qui avait appel√© √† r√©former la loi tr√®s controvers√©e sur le blasph√®me.
nz-cyb/am
X
Commentaires

author: @rtenews
title: Scientists discover how to make Martian soil into blocks
text:
Researchers at Trinity College Dublin have discovered a way of converting loose soil and rocks found on the surface of Mars and the moon into construction blocks that could be used to build future settlements.
Scientists who are based at the AMBER Centre in Trinity found that regolith, an assortment of loose surface deposits made of dust and broken rocks, can be converted into strong building materials using small quantities of carbon nanotubes.
The research team has demonstrated how the nanotubes can be used as a binder to convert fine sand into solid blocks with a strength approaching that of granite.
The discovery paves the way for nanotubes that can be used to fabricate structural materials in extraterrestrial environments, negating the need to transport construction materials and equipment into space.
The researchers believe the discovery could also have practical implications for the construction industry on Earth.
The findings were published in a scientific journal earlier this year, and Trinity College is highlighting the discovery today to mark the start of 'Space Week Ireland'.
Project leader, Professor Jonathan Coleman, said that the construction blocks conduct electricity, meaning that they could also be used as internal sensors to monitor the structural health of extraterrestrial buildings.
"The composites are also electrically conductive and show a sensitive piezoresistive response - a change in the electrical resistivity of a material when mechanical strain is applied - allowing them to be used to monitor their own structural health," Professor Coleman said.
The Advanced Materials and BioEngineering Research (AMBER) Centre is funded by Taighde √âireann ‚Äì Research Ireland and is hosted by Trinity College Dublin.
Running from the 4-10 of October, Space Week Ireland is an annual celebration of Ireland's involvement in space research and innovation, with events taking place across the country aiming to inspire people of all ages to explore the universe.

author: Devdiscourse News Desk
title: Deadly Encounter: Man Fatally Shot After Opening Fire at State Police Barracks | Law-Order
text:
Deadly Encounter: Man Fatally Shot After Opening Fire at State Police Barracks
A man was shot dead by troopers after he fired at a State Police barracks in Malta, New York. Using a hunting-style rifle, the suspect opened fire before being engaged and fatally wounded by troopers. The incident posed no ongoing threat to public safety.
- Country:
- United States
In a shocking turn of events, a man was fatally shot by troopers on Wednesday after he initiated gunfire at a State Police barracks in upstate New York, authorities announced.
The suspect, armed with a hunting-style rifle, launched his attack shortly before 2 pm at the Saratoga barracks in Malta, which is situated roughly 30 miles north of Albany, the state's capital. According to a police statement, gunfire erupted outside the barracks.
Upon receiving reports of gunshots, troopers vacated the building and engaged the perpetrator, ultimately fatally wounding him. Police have confirmed that the roads around the area were shut down for a couple of hours as investigations proceeded, but there was no ongoing threat to public safety.
(With inputs from agencies.)

author: mariana pedrozo
title: Com alopecia, Gretchen aparece sem o mega hair
text:
Nesta quarta-feira (22), Gretchen apareceu nas suas redes sociais para mostrar seu cabelo sem mega hair para os seguidores. A cantora sofre de alopecia, condi√ß√£o que causa a perda de cabelos e pelos.
‚ÄúN√£o √© toda mulher que tem coragem de se mostrar sem o mega hair. E, principalmente, a mulher que tem alopecia, mas eu n√£o me importo‚Äù, come√ßou Gretchen nos Stories do Instagram.
‚ÄúFa√ßo quest√£o que as pessoas vejam a realidade do meu cabelo‚Äù, concluiu. No √∫ltimo s√°bado (18), Gretchen compartilhou o resultado de uma mudan√ßa no visual, onde mostrou o novo mega hair e tamb√©m rebateu algumas cr√≠ticas dos internautas.
‚Äú√â s√≥ eu colocar meu cabelo que os haters come√ßam a entrar no meu direct para falar besteira‚Äù, disse ela. A artista afirma que, apesar dos coment√°rios negativos, ela continuar√° optando pelo mega hair, j√° que a agrada. ‚ÄúIndependente do meu cabelo crescer ou n√£o, eu vou usar o mega hair, porque √© uma op√ß√£o minha e eu gosto‚Äù, declarou.

author: VNExplorer
title: Al Sharpton delivers fiery remarks on race and Trump and brings out Central Park 5
text: Al Sharpton speaks at the DNC. Getty Images hide caption toggle caption Getty Images The NPR Network will be reporting live from Chicago throughout the week bringing you the latest on the Democratic National Convention. In remarks that leaned heavily on his background as a reverend, Al Sharpton delivered an impassioned speech on the fourth night of the DNC. ‚ÄúOn one side of this race is Donald Trump, a fellow New Yorker I‚Äôve known for 40 years. Only once ‚Äî once ‚Äî in that time did he take a position on racial issues,‚Äù Sharpton said. ‚ÄúHe spent a small fortune on full-page ads calling for the execution of five innocent young teenagers,‚Äù Sharpton said in reference to the Central Park Five. These were five Black and Brown New York teenagers who were wrongly convicted of rape. Trump took out ads in the newspaper calling to reinstate the death penalty. ‚ÄúIt was there that I saw Trump loved to fan racial flames,‚Äù Sharpton said. ‚ÄúOn the other side is a woman that I‚Äôve walked with in Selma, Alabama to commemorate the 59th anniversary of Bloody Sunday. Kamala Harris spoke to me that day about unity and passing bills.‚Äù Sharpton later introduced the Central Park Five to deliver joint remarks. Members of the Central Park 5 voice their support for Harris Exonerated members of the ‚ÄúCentral Park Five" called on the DNC audience to "vote with us" for Democratic presidential candidate Kamala Harris. In 2002, the five men ‚Äî Antron McCray, Kevin Richardson, Raymond Santana, Korey Wise and Yusef Salaam (now a member of New York City Council) ‚Äî saw their convictions vacated for a 1989 crime in which a white jogger was badly beaten and raped in Central Park. The crime dominated headlines in the city, already dealing with racial tensions. At the time, former President Donald Trump, then a rising real-estate mogul in New York, took out full-page ads in newspapers demanding the state bring back the death penalty. The five were just teens when the attack took place, but police rounded them up and interrogated them for the crime. They were convicted and served years in prison before the case got another look. Another man, a serial rapist and killer, eventually confessed to the crime. "45 wanted us unalive," Salaam said, referring to Trump, the nation's 45th president. "Today we are exonerated because the actual perpetrator confessed and DNA proved it. [Trump] still says he still stands by the original guilty verdict. He dismisses scientific evidence rather than admit he was wrong." Salaam spoke alongside activists Wise, Santana and Richardson. McCray was not in attendance for the address. Trump has not apologized for taking out the full-page ad (which didn't name the five men explicitly) and in 2019 said, ‚ÄúYou have people on both sides of that. They admitted their guilt.‚Äù The New York Times reported Trump said, ‚ÄúIf you look at some of the prosecutors, they think that the city never should have settled that case ‚Äî so we‚Äôll leave it at that.‚Äù After their convictions were vacated, the five men received a multi-million dollar settlement from New York City.

author: Contact Information ReadersMagnet Publishing; Marketing ReadersMagnet LLC
title: Kizito Osudibia Set to Exhibit at HKBF 2024 with Book That Calls for Peace Out of the Ashes of Religious Violence
text:
Kizito Osudibia Set to Exhibit at HKBF 2024 with Book That Calls for Peace Out of the Ashes of Religious Violence
Much like Hong Kong itself, the Hong Kong Book Fair is a prestigious event that takes global ideas from authors around the world and helps circulate them to readers across Asia. For Kizito Chike Osudibia, a Colorado-based Catholic priest and dedicated political analyst, one of the most important ideas today is to lay the foundations of world peace, especially from religions often accused of creating conflict. He makes the case for it in his book ‚ÄúReligion and the Global Resurgence of Violence.‚Äù
WEBWIRE‚Äì Friday, May 31, 2024
ReadersMagnet will display ‚ÄúReligion and the Global Resurgence of Violence‚Äù by Kizito Chike Osudibia at the Hong Kong Book Fair 2024.
The
Hong Kong Book Fair is one of Asia‚Äôs largest, busiest book fairs, and it offers authors from around the world an opportunity to spread their ideas to more reading audiences across the East.
It‚Äôs a very fitting venue for Kizito Chike Osudibia, whose book tackles a most urgent global challenge once again taking today‚Äôs headlines: violence. The of his book says it all: ‚ÄúReligion and the Global Resurgence of Violence: Connection of the Abrahamics.‚Äù
From the very start, the book tackles a troubling and persistent accusation that religion is the cause of today‚Äôs most violent conflicts. To an extent, Osudibia actually agrees and goes to considerable lengths to validate this sentiment.
However, he also makes the radical proposal that the very same religions that have historically fostered these conflicts also have, at their very root, the ability to end it all and create a lasting peace that ultimately lives up to the faith each one professes.
A Catholic priest, Osudibia currently serves as the pastor of Holy Trinity Catholic Church in Colorado Springs, Colorado, and is also a dedicated scholar of political science. Aside from religion, he has also published several books on the politics of Nigeria but now sees that the leaders of all three leading Abrahamic faiths play a crucial role in fostering peace on a global stage.
Visitors to the 2024 Hong Kong Book Fair can find ‚ÄúReligion and the Global Resurgence of Violence: Connection of the Abrahamics‚Äù displayed at the self-publishing and book marketing company ReadersMagnet‚Äôs booth exhibit. Copies are also available directly from
Amazon, Barnes & Noble, and ReadersMagnet Bookstore.
‚ÄúReligion and the Global Resurgence of Violence: Connection of the Abrahamics‚Äù
Author: Kizito Chike Osudibia
Published date: June 22, 2023
Publisher: ReadersMagnet, LLC
Genre: Political & Social Sciences
Author Bio
Kizito Chike Osudibia is a priest of the Catholic Church. Currently, he is pastor of Holy Trinity Catholic Church in Colorado Springs, Colorado. The author, who is a scholar and pastor, holds a BPhil (1989), a BTh (1993), an MA in political science (2010), a doctorate degree in civil and organizational leadership, EdD (2015) and a doctorate in Political Science, PhD (2018).
He has confidence that ideas change, rule, and sustain the world of change. Hence, the idea that the Abrahamic religions, numbering more than half of the world‚Äôs population, can bring enduring peace to the globe is, for him, a desideratum. His arguments speak for themselves in this book.
Among his published books are ‚ÄúNigeria: The Case of Fragmentation‚Äù (1995), ‚ÄúChallenges to the Fourth Republic: Nigerian Connexion‚Äù (2001), and ‚ÄúRevolution: A Dangerous Option for Nigeria‚Äù (2004).
( Press Release Image:
https://photos.webwire.com/prmedia/55089/322540/322540-1.jpg )
WebWireID322540

author: Samuel P. Medenilla
title: Comelec holding massive voter ed drive for BARMM polls
text:
WITH less than a year before the first ever Parliamentary Elections in the Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao (BARMM), the Commission on Elections will be conducting a massive voter education campaign in the region to make sure the landmark event is held successfully.
Comelec spokesman Atty. John Rex Laudiangco said the information drive aims to make voters well-informed during the BARMM Parliamentary Election (BPE), which will coincide with the next National and Local Elections (NLE) on May 12, 2025.
‚ÄúThe BARMM Parliamentary Elections is the culmination of the Bangsamoro Peoples‚Äô decades-long struggle for recognition and self-determination. Therefore, we deem it important to educate the BARMM voters on the new voting system to ensure the success of this historic electoral exercise,‚Äù Laudiangco said in a statement Thursday.
A highlight of the campaign spearheaded by Comelec‚Äôs Education and Information Department (EID) is the Voter Education Micro Summits, to be conducted by its voter education teams in September.
The summits will feature experts from the Comelec‚Äôs EID and Law Department, who will discuss the composition of the Bangsamoro Parliament, the system of proportional representation, the allocation of parliamentary seats, the manner of their election, among others.
Comelec Chairman George M. Garcia said other matters to be tackled in the information drive are how to use the Automated Counting Machines (ACM) and the two ballots that will be used in the BPE.
There will also be discussions on how to avoid vote-buying, terrorism and violence.
‚ÄúIt is our hope that after the Summit, we will be able to secure the participating organizations commitment to help increase awareness in the Bangsamoro Parliamentary Elections,‚Äù Laudiangco said.
A total of 80 parliamentary seats will be available in the BPE. Most or 40 of the seats will be allocated for the representatives of Regional Political Parties.
Another 32 seats will be for representatives of Parliamentary Districts and the last remaining eight seats are reserved for sectoral representatives namely, the Non-Moro Indigenous Peoples (NMIPs), Settler Communities, Women, Youth, Traditional Leaders and Ulama.
